file_content.text: It's time to get to work.
...I don't care what your plan is! We're not sticking around to get eaten alive. Me and my crew are leaving--period.
If you want to abandon the work you agreed to do for the Republic, I can't stop you. But you aren't leaving.
A six-month quarantine requirement has been put into effect. Anyone trying to leave without prior authorization is subject.
You can sit in a medical bay and go broke, or you can help us accomplish something unprecedented. It's your choice.
Overcome your fears--help us save this world for the future.
Don't give up the cause, men!
Repairing this world will inspire the whole Republic. Don't you want to be a part of that?
We're in this together, men.
Well... yeah, but we aren't looking to die in the process.
Hold the line and work together--that's the Republic way.
This is no time to quit, men.
If they aren't being paid anymore, can I get their share?
More credits for me, then?
Hey! Just who do you think you are?
You shouldn't be so harsh, Governor. These men aren't fighters.
Go easy on them.
We are what we choose to be.
We risked our lives out there so you could work. And now you quit?
Ungrateful jerks.
I put my life on the line to keep you safe. This is how you repay me?
Ungrateful jerks.
This is insane! We're construction workers, we didn't sign up for this!
I know you're going to make the right decision here, Hull. Come back when you do.
Unfortunately, not everyone flourishes in the face of adversity.
Scouting parties are already reporting lower rakghoul populations. Most of our work crews are gearing up--we're finally gonna get this project moving.
I'll look forward to seeing what you do with the place.
Congratulations.
If things are back on track, does that mean you'll have time for dinner sometime?
[Flirt] We should go out.
Social engagements aren't in the cards for the time being, but it's kind of you to ask.
Is there something more I could do to help, Governor?
Need anything else?
Not at the moment--but I'm sure there will be. I'll have Bardo and Strom find you if anything comes up.
There are still a lot of rakghouls and wreckage out there.
That sounds premature.
Obstacles exist to be overcome.
My ancestors called Taris home, once. Thanks to you, millions of people might call it home again someday.
Stay safe. And stay in touch.
We're all counting on you.
...I'm sure it would work if we had the manpower, but we don't. The numbers just aren't on our side.
Success isn't in the numbers, Chief. We don't need more people--we need the right people.
If a simple Jedi can be of assistance, it would be an honor.
I hope I can help.
Ah, Master Jedi--wonderful to see you again. Thank you for coming by.
I appreciate you coming on such short notice, Master Jedi--I'm Governor Saresh.
It's surprising how much can be achieved by the right person in the right place.
I couldn't agree more.
I'd say you're living proof of the idea, Master Jedi. Welcome.
Ah, Master Jedi, welcome. I appreciate you hearing my request--I'm Governor Saresh.
Havoc Squad is ready for assignment, Governor.
Reporting for duty.
No need for formalities--it's good to see you again.
No need for such formalities, soldier. Thank you for coming--I'm Governor Saresh.
When you want things done right, I'm the one to see.
That's why I'm here.
So we've learned, Captain. It's good to see you again.
I'm glad Bardo and Strom found you, Captain--thank you for coming. I'm Governor Saresh.
Excuse me, but I was told to meet with Governor Saresh?
Sorry to interrupt.
Finish your talk later--I'm here and I don't have all day.
This meeting is over.
Ah, hello again. I appreciate you coming to hear me out.
Bardo and Strom found you after all, good. Thank you for coming--I'm Governor Saresh.
Our goal on Taris is straightforward: rebuild everything the Sith destroyed, and remind the galaxy that the Republic never gives up.
But resources are tight, and we have some serious challenges: toxic chemical spills, scavenging pirates and... the wildlife.
Rakghouls. You've fought your share, I'm sure. They're using tunnels in the old ruins to surprise our soldiers and wipe out our work crews.
Rakghouls--one bad bite can turn you into a vicious monster just like them. There's thousands out there... maybe even millions.
All darkness can be overcome with perseverance.
Don't give up hope.
I knew you were the right Jedi to seek out.
Corrupted creatures, spreading their corruption through violence.
They sound formidable.
That about sums them up. Nasty, nasty creatures.
Just tell me how to take these things down, and I'll get started.
How do you kill them?
Killing them isn't the issue--not exactly.
Guess this place won't top any "desirable destination" lists anytime soon.
Sounds like a mess.
With your help, it might someday.
Where do these creatures come from? How did they get here?
Tell me more about rakghouls.
No one's totally sure. They were here before the Sith bombardment, and their numbers have only grown since then.
A bunch of mindless beasts are holding back the whole Republic?
This is pathetic.
These creatures are anything but mindless.
The rakghouls use tunnels buried in the ruins to attack by surprise and overwhelm our soldiers. Every work crew we send out is decimated.
We came here to achieve the greatest reconstruction project in Republic history. Instead, the workers hide in this outpost like frightened children. No more.
What can we do to push these creatures back and keep your workers safe?
Let's not waste time.
With respect, it sounds like your men have good reasons to be afraid.
Don't be too harsh.
You're right, of course. That's why Chief Trig has developed a plan....
Let's find out where the rakghouls are coming from and take the fight to them.
So we turn the tables.
We have scientists working on locating the rakghouls' lairs. Until they do, we have to settle for the next best thing. Chief Trig has a plan....
I do some of my best work while I'm hiding, thank you very much.
Nothing wrong with hiding.
I don't doubt it. But we'll never make any progress from behind our walls. Chief Trig has developed a plan....
I can definitely see how you got to be in charge, Governor.
[Flirt] Consider me inspired.
I just try to do my part.
This is very serious for you, isn't it?
You aren't messing around.
I've never cared much for failure.
I came to work, not listen to speeches. What's the plan?
Skip the big talk.
We need to level the field so our security forces can do their job. Chief Trig has put together a plan....
...A suicidal plan....
...A bold plan to collapse the tunnels the rakghouls are using to ambush our people. I know you're up for the task.
Old ventilation shafts still connect a few hubs in the tunnel network to the surface. Drop explosives in enough of them, and the whole thing collapses.
A Jedi is prepared to face any danger, Governor.
I'll take care of it.
Hopefully, this will seal the rakghouls' warrens as well as their escape routes.
Excellent plan.
Let's hope we're so lucky.
Simple demo op--consider it done.
No problem.
Simple except for the thousands of hungry monsters waiting to eat you whole.
Been a while since I blew up tunnels inside monster-infested ruins. What's the hourly rate these days?
Let's talk pay.
I'll put down my own funds to make this happen. We've been held back for too long--it's time for progress, whatever the cost.
Don't you have soldiers here who could handle the job?
What's stopping you?
Large groups of soldiers attract too many rakghouls, just like the work crews. We need to keep this small.
I assume you and your "associates" won't back off until this is dealt with.
If it gets you off my back.
You aren't prisoners here.
You aren't a prisoner here.
I'd prefer that you do this because you see why our work here is important.
You each have a reputation for handling extraordinary situations.
You have a reputation for overcoming impossible odds.
Live up to that reputation. Help us transform Taris into the future of the Republic.
I'm afraid I'm busy at the moment. Please make an appointment with one of my aides.
Welcome to Taris--I'm Governor Saresh. On behalf of the Galactic Republic, I want to thank you for joining us in this historic project.
For your safety, please do not travel beyond the military-secured safe zone outside the settlement.
This world and our work here will shine as a beacon of hope to all of the Republic. But first, we have many obstacles to overcome.
Together, we stand taller than any obstacle. Let's get to work--together.
